meanings.definition: To produce and discharge a substance
meanings.sent1: The flower can secrete nectar to attract bees.
meanings.sent2: The glands in the body secrete hormones for various functions.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky squirrel tried to secrete its acorn stash from other animals.
meanings.sent4: The factory seemed to secrete an endless stream of smoke into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The volcano started to secrete lava, creating a dangerous situation for the nearby village.

meanings.sent1: She tried to secrete her diary in a secret drawer.
meanings.sent2: The spy needed to secrete the classified documents before being caught.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to secrete the disappearing rabbit in his hat.
meanings.sent4: The treasure was cleverly secreted in a hidden compartment of the old chest.
meanings.sent5: The detective found a way to secrete the evidence to protect the case from tampering.
